Posts.Content: Jul 15, 2007 09:45PM abbie10 wrote: I would like to tell you I did not have that first pain. I had a cyst and an area that was cancer. They had to do a lot of work to reach the areas. Used the ultra sound and xray to guide them. It sound like a staple gun when they remove several pieces of solid tissue, the tumor was size of a pea. Three people working on me. After the collection they applied pressure to area for a certain amount of time. Then ice pack. This is standard, for this lab then, pressure and ice they sent me home with ice pack in bra. They did not hurt me even one time was not sore the next day. May you too have a good experience. Of course they called me in a couple of days with the bad news. I already new. The nurse gave it away it the look on her face as they were putting sample in tube. the best to you. stage1
Posts.Title: Core Biopsy chitchat101 abbie10

Posts.Content: Mar 25, 2008 10:39PM abbie10 wrote: Jan 07 want to let you know I have no side effects  Doctors comment that breast was soft,would not know I had rads.  Only thing I did was I craved vit C so drink a lot of juice daily and I used lotion on breast before leaving the room were I had rads .  So you too can be ok.  Also I prayed as they zaped me. So here is for a good out come for all.  I am also fair skined age 61
